plotting package¶

Submodules¶

plotting.forecasting module¶

plotting.forecasting.animate_forecast(forecasts, true_values, date_offset, y_lim_mod=0.2, interval=300, ylims=None)¶

Produces an animation of given forecasts atop the original values.

Parameters

  • forecasts –

  • true_values –

  • date_offset – date offset left and right to the currently shown forecast

  • y_lim_mod – percentage of the currently shown y amplitude to be added to each side of ylim

  • interval – interval between frames in miliseconds

  • ylims – Sets ylim during the whole animation. If set, ignores y_lim_mod and ylim is not auto adjusted during the animation.

Returns

the animation object that needs to be stored for the duration of the animation (or for however long you need it to run)

plotting.general module¶

plotting.general.plot_correlation_matrix(df, figsize=None)¶
plotting.general.plot_twin_y_axes(series_1, series_2, label1, label2, color1, color2, ax=None, **kwargs)¶

Useful for plotting data that needs to be observed on the same graph, but that “lives” in different scales etc. mean and std of a variable

Parameters

  • series_1 – a tuple (x axis, y axis), pd.Series or simple array plotted on the left

  • series_2 – a tuple (x axis, y axis), pd.Series or simple array plotted on the right

  • color1 –

  • color2 –

  • ax –

Returns

plotting.timeseries module¶

plotting.timeseries.plot_seasonal_decompose(decompose: statsmodels.tsa.seasonal.DecomposeResult, figsize=(20, 12), period_name=None)¶

Plotting of a seasonal decomposition on 4 axes, one for each component. Components are plotted in the order: observed, seasonal, trend and residuals. plt.show() still needs to be called after this function.

Parameters

  • decompose – result of a statsmodels decomposition (STL, seasonal_decompose, etc.)

  • figsize – figsize of the whole plot

  • period_name – Used to adjust titles, examples are “Weekly”, “Daily”, etc.

Returns

tuple of 4 axes

plotting.timeseries.plot_series_segments(series, index_pairs)¶

Plots the segments of the given series defined by index_pairs

Parameters

  • series – pd.Series whose segments will be plotted.

  • index_pairs – list of tuples (segment_index_start, segment_index_end) defining each segment
